4.code:
from django.shortcuts import render
from qrcode import QRCode  # Import QRCode library
def generate_qrcode(request):
    data = request.POST.get('data')  # Get user input data
qrc = QRCode(version=1, box_size=10, border=4)
qrc.add_data(data)
qrc.make(fit=True)
return render(request, 'qrcode_generator.html', {'qr_code_img': qrc.make_image()})

4.description: Template for the QR code generator page.

]

from django.contrib import admin
from django.urls import path
from .views import home, usage, features, support
urlpatterns = [
    path('admin/', admin.site.urls),
    path('', home, name='home'),
    path('usage/', usage, name='usage'),
    path('features/', features, name='features'),
    path('support/', support, name='support'),
]

from django.db import models
class Transaction(models.Model): 
    amount = models.DecimalField(max_digits=10, decimal_places=2)
    category = models.CharField(max_length=50)
    date = models.DateTimeField()
    description = models.TextField()
    is_income = models.BooleanField()

from django.urls import path
from . import views
app = [path('', views.dashboard, name='dashboard'),
              path('transactions/', views.transactions_list, name='transactions_list')
             ]
def describe(): pass

admin.site.register(Customer)
 admin.site.register(Product)

from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression 
import pandas as pd

def train_model():
    # Load processed data (you may need to fetch from a database or memory)
    data = pd.read_csv('processed_data.csv')

    X = data[['variable1', 'variable2', ...]] 
    y = data['result'].shift(1)  # Apply lag based on user selection

    model = LogisticRegression()
    model.fit(X, y)
